 Community Tested How to Enable Dark Theme in Windows 10   
 The anniversary update of Windows 10 came with a fun new theme for users. [1]  The much requested dark theme is now an option for anyone bored by the old light color scheme. This article will guide you if you want to switch to the new and fresh dark theme in Windows 10. 
 Before you start:  This article will be doable only if you have already upgraded to the anniversary edition of Windows 10. Learn how to do it here. 
 Steps Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/75\/Change-Your-App-Mode-in-Windows-10-Step-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Change-Your-App-Mode-in-Windows-10-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/75\/Change-Your-App-Mode-in-Windows-10-Step-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Change-Your-App-Mode-in-Windows-10-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open the Settings app .  Press the Start button and select the settings gear from the lower right corner.
 2 Click or tap the  Personalization  category. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Enable-Dark-Theme-in-Windows-10-Step-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Enable-Dark-Theme-in-Windows-10-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Enable-Dark-Theme-in-Windows-10-Step-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Enable-Dark-Theme-in-Windows-10-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Select  Colors  from the left pane. 
 4 
 Change the app mode.  Scroll down and find the section labeled as "Choose your default app mode". Pick "Dark" or "Light" from the list to change the look of Windows. Enjoy the beauty of black, or bright white!
